Macroinvertebrate Metrics

Source: vignettes/macroinvertebrate-metrics.Rmd
macroinvertebrate-metrics.Rmd

Welcome

This document has been created following the generic assessment guidance.

Description

Basic details about the assessment. Update the â€˜responseâ€™ values as required.

#> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 2
#>   question   response                            
#>   <chr>      <chr>                               
#> 1 name_short Macroinvertebrate Metrics           
#> 2 name_long  Freshwater Macroinvertebrate Metrics
#> 3 parameter  River Invertevates                  
#> 4 status     prototype

Input

A list of questions required to run the assessment.

#> # A tibble: 1 Ã— 9
#>   sample_id question        response label    parameter type  max   min   source
#>   <chr>     <chr>           <chr>    <chr>    <chr>     <chr> <lgl> <lgl> <chr> 
#> 1 12345     Taxon abundance 12       Baetidae River Faâ€¦ numbâ€¦ NA    NA    sepa_â€¦

Assessment

If applicable, write a function to assess your input data and return an outcome. For example, a metric, statistic, prediction etc.

Outcome

The outcome of your assessment.

#>   sample_id           question                          response
#> 1     12345     EPSI Score TL2                               100
#> 2     12345 EPSI Condition TL2 Minimally sedimented/unsedimented
#> 3     12345         WHPT_SCORE                               5.9
#> 4     12345          WHPT_ASPT                               5.9
#> 5     12345         WHPT_NTAXA                                 1

Run checks on the assessment.

#> Test passed ðŸŽŠ

check value

standard_required_values TRUE

Update

Update the catalogue of assessments to make them available.

#> âœ” Setting active project to '/home/runner/work/hera/hera'
#> âœ” Saving 'catalogue' to 'data/catalogue.rda'
#> â€¢ Document your data (see 'https://r-pkgs.org/data.html')

After updating the catalogue, rebuild the package, click on Build > Install and Restart menu or â€˜Install and Restartâ€™ button in the Build pane.
